intro: Achyranthes cyclophylla, commonly known as the cyclophylla spurge, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and often showy floral structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring upright stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
